channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report E-2023070610
item.description:
Report E-2023070610

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBI experienced a liquid UN1498 OxyFresh release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-ounces of product released impacting the tote body only due to a missing cap. Contractors replaced the cap and wiped the tote down for shipment on. The damaged cap and impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023070712
item.description:
Report E-2023070712

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: POCATELLO
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 275 gallon tote of ferric sulfate solution (un3264) releasing 70 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070664
item.description:
Report E-2023070664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon pails of resin (un1866) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 16 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
